actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2384.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Hill (AR) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 2384 — "To establish an Independent Financial Technology Working Group to Combat Terrorism and Illicit Financing, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3357.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Hill (AR) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3357 — "To amend the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 to require issuers with a multi-class stock structure to make certain disclosures in any proxy or consent solicitation material, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3339.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Hill (AR) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3339 — "To require certification examinations for accredited investors, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1469.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Hill (AR) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1469 — "To create an interdivisional taskforce at the Securities and Exchange Commission for senior investors."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3343.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Hill (AR) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3343 — "To amend the Federal securities laws to specify the periods for which financial statements are required to be provided by an emerging growth company, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3351.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Hill (AR) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3351 — "To amend the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 to specify that actions of the Advocate for Small Business Capital Formation are not a collection of information under the Paperwork Reduction Act."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3382.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Hill (AR) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3382 — "To require the Securities and Exchange Commission to carry out a study and rulemaking on the definition of the term "small entity" under the securities laws for purposes of chapter 6 of title 5, United States Code, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1043.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Gosar moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1043 — "To direct the Secretary of the Interior to convey certain Federal land in Arizona to La Paz County, Arizona, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 131.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Gosar moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 131 — "To make certain modifications to the repayment for the Arkansas Valley Conduit in the State of Colorado."
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 183.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Stauber moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 183 — "To amend the Federal Lands Recreation Enhancement Act to provide for a lifetime National Recreational Pass for law enforcement officers."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3095.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Comer moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3095 — "To direct the United States Postal Service to designate single, unique ZIP Codes for certain communities, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 672.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Comer moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 672 — "To establish new ZIP Codes for certain communities, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2625.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 2625 — "To amend title 38, United States Code, to update certain terminology regarding veteran employment."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2170.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 2170 — "To name the Department of Veterans Affairs community-based outpatient clinic in Toms River, New Jersey, the Leonard G. 'Bud' Lomell, VA Clinic, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 201.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 201 — "To provide for a study by the National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine on the prevalence and mortality of cancer among individuals who served as active duty aircrew in the Armed Forces, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 423.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 423 — "To protect regular order for budgeting for the Department of Veterans Affairs, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of July 21.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.

actions-list.header: ADJUSTMENT OF THE WHOLE NUMBER OF THE HOUSE
actions-list.actionItem: Under clause 5(d) of Rule XX, the Chair announced to the House that, in light of the resignation of the gentleman Tennessee, Mr. Green, the whole number of the House is 431.
The Chair designated Mr. Ezell to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of July 21.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable David J. Taylor to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
